body: At the moment, doccano is a nice and lightweight tool focused on annotation. "Weighing down" doccano with features not directly related to annotation may be seen as a negative.  @Hironsan, it would be useful to get your take on this.  The [feature ideas](https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/projects/2) are useful, but I would also appreciate your thoughts on the scope of doccano (maybe in a different thread).

issue.title: Alignment for import data format and export data format

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Right row doccano support for importing labeled dataset, and it is a wonderful feature for the [human in the loop](https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/issues/11#issuecomment-464106275). 

But I noticed that the import data format is different from the export data format. Take the sequence labeling task as an example.

The labeled data format is like below. 
```
{"text": "EU rejects German call to boycott British lamb.", "labels": [ [0, 2, "ORG"], [11, 17, "MISC"]]}
{"text": "Peter Blackburn", "labels": [ [0, 15, "PERSON"] ]}
{"text": "President Obama", "labels": [ [10, 15, "PERSON"] ]}
```
The output data format looks like this. I will call it `format 0` in below.
```
{"id": 15, "text": "EU rejects German call to boycott British lamb.", "annotations": [{"label": 7, "start_offset": 0, "end_offset": 2, "user": 1}, {"label": 6, "start_offset": 11, "end_offset": 17, "user": 1}], "meta": {}}
{"id": 16, "text": "Peter Blackburn", "annotations": [{"label": 8, "start_offset": 0, "end_offset": 15, "user": 1}], "meta": {}}
{"id": 17, "text": "President Obama", "annotations": [{"label": 8, "start_offset": 10, "end_offset": 15, "user": 1}], "meta": {}}
```
The major problem is that the output only show the label id, rather than the label name. So if I want to import this data into doccano again, I have to figure out which label belong to which word. And the output key name is `annotations` instead of `labels`. It would be better to make them use the same key name for the consistency.  We can use `labels` as the key for import data, export data and in classification task and sequecne to sequence task. 

# Method 1

The output format could like this, `format 1`:
```
{
"doc_id": 15, "text": "EU rejects German call to boycott British lamb.",  
"labels": [[0, 2, "ORG"], [11, 17, "MISC"]], 
"meta": {}
}
```
This format can **derectly import to doccano again**, and can be read by spaCy easliy. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10768193/54412012-882c8000-4734-11e9-9da8-b8bdc1456203.png)

The output is like this
```
{
"doc_id": 18, 
"text": "EU rejects German call to boycott British lamb.",  
"labels": [[0, 2, "ORG"], [11, 17, "MISC"], [34, 41, "ORG"], 
"meta": {}
}
```
This is the most simple format. We only need to change the export code.

Another format for this is using the dictionary to save the label information, just like `format 0`. It would make the export data more readable and we need to change the format of import data to be the same with `format 0`. 

```
{
"text": "EU rejects German call to boycott British lamb.", 
"annotations": [{"label_name": "label1", "start_offset": 0, "end_offset": 2}, {"label_name": "label2", "start_offset": 11, "end_offset": 17, "user": 1}], 
"meta": {}
}
```

But we can't know who annotate which label in this way.

# Method 2

We can save the `doc_id`, `label_id`, `user_id` in `meta` key. 

The output data `format 2`

```
{
"doc_id": 18, "text": "EU rejects German call to boycott British lamb.",  
 "labels": [[0, 2, "ORG", "user1"], [11, 17, "MISC", "user2"]], 
 "meta": {"label_id": {"MISC": 6, "ORG":8,}, "user_id": {"user1": 1, "user2":2}}
}
```

But this format needs to change the import data code to deal with the "user1" value in `[0, 2, "ORG", "user1"]` if the user provides this value. 

The goal is directly to import this data format to doccano again. 

# Method 3

The user can write the script to translate the export format to import format. But still, we should provide enough information in the export data. We should include the label name into `format 0` and the `labels` or `annotations` key name should be consistent. 

# Method 4 

Two download buttons, one button for the simple export format (`format 1`) so the user can directly import the data into doccano again, and use spaCy deal with data easily. The second button for the detailed export format (`format 0` with label name). Users should write the script by themselves.

body:
> @lfoppiano in [this comment](https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/issues/113#issuecomment-473184972) you mentioned
> 
> > Lastly having user information would be additionally great if we want to compute IAA measures from the exported data ;-)
> 
> I am not familiar with the acronym "IAA", care to share here? It might be relevant to this discussion 😃

Sorry for the confusion, I was reading them from my mobile and I mixed up the threads and replied on the wrong one. With IAA I meant "Inter Annotator Agreement" measures.

+1. This would be a super useful feature to make doccano more usable in large-scale annotation projects where we potentially can have many annotators with lots of different types of backgrounds and reliability!

I wonder if it would be possible to build these sorts of extra statistics (see also https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/issues/42) as a [Grafana](https://grafana.com/) dashboard ontop of the Doccano database.

This would provide a nice decoupling of the visualizations and Doccano. It also means that Doccano doesn't have to build and support all these rich visualizations and instead only needs to include the dashboard SQL queries for Grafana.

The disadvantage is that the dashboard SQL queries may have to be re-written for each underlying database (e.g. SQLite vs Postgres) since we no longer have access to the ORM to iron out differences in SQL dialects for us.

Thoughts?

Hi,
I'm actually from the [competition](https://lighttag.io) but I thought I'd share where we want to improve with this feature and what's been hard. We're hearing more and more about docanno so I'd like to try and engage, maybe we can cross pollinate. 

The django-orm doesn't work well for these kinds of queries. We've experimented with both reading from views and writing a custom manager for Models whose queryset runs raw sql. The latter is more flexible but the views need to be managed, typically inside migrations, which gets hard. The raw sql mode makes the sql in the code which is great, but restricts you to RawQuerysets which have a slightly different API then regular querysets and so tend to break existing views and tests. 

Analytics features in general tend to "break" often, because they are dependent on the underlying model and because you will want to extend them almost infinetly (add filters, secondary aggregations etc). These tend to add up quickly to a lot of SQL that is hard to maintain. We are quite frustrated with this and are trying to figure out if we can just expose SQL to the user directly (probably not) . 

Users will expect (and rightly so) these features to stay up to date with the rest the app, for instance if you are adding "pre-annotations" then you want to see the breakdown of tags by annotator, sub divided by whether they were suggested by a pre-annotation or naturally occurring. Likewise, if docanno ever gets into managing tasks (e.g. user A and B work on X and A,C,F work on Y) then the way the metrics are calculated need to take that into account (did A disagree with B, or did they just not work on the same document ? ) 

All that aside, you can get over most of this by pulling the data into a dataframe and doing the calculations in pandas inside a django view. We did this for a while and stopped because it got to be computationally inefficient, but that is more important to us as a SaaS provider than it may be for most individuals use case. 

I have loads more to add, not sure if I'm in the right place so will leave it here and see how it goes. 

Cheers

For each project, propose to introduce a (assignable by project admin) property, N - minimal number of annotations (of a given document) to indicate the document as "done". (I.e. N = 1 now).

issue.title: Improvement Idea for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you want to add the feature to doccano**  
**Please upvote 👍 related issue that let us judge priority .**

We show 👍 if someone upvote, and 🤩 means over 10 vote

## Toward More Practical Annotation Tool

### Annotation

* Display
  - [ ] : Support HTML syntax in Document #35 👍
* Filter
  - [ ] : Arrange Annotation Status and Filter by it #280 👍
* Label
  - [ ] : Provide for setting the order of labels #816
  - [ ] : Group labels by the same color #477
  - [ ] : Support multiple kinds of label set #5 👍
  - [x] : Display shortkey in labels selector (on Annotation page) #834
* Annotation
  - [x] : keyboard shortcut for approval button #718 👍
  - [x] : A button to clear the markup. #631
  - [ ] : Automatically select the sequential characters in the sequence labeling task by the hover. #666
  - [ ] : Show context when annotation. #466 
* Navigation
  - [x] : Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset. #540 👍
  - [x] : "First" and "Last" buttons #615
* Productivity
  - [ ] : Display the who annotated the document #881
  - [x] : Support Comments when Annotating #1050
  - [ ] : Enable Stats view for non-admins #270 👍
* Portability
  - [ ] : Project export and import #901

### Dataset

* Import/Export
  - [x] : Convert label to label-ID when exporting #295 🤩
  - [x] : Import the exported annotation data and keep the all original info #482
  - [x] : Support JSON format (not JSONL) #454 👍
  - [x] : Make maximum file upload (import) size configurable #708 👍
* Management
  - [x] : Bulk Delete #523

## Toward Advanced Annotation Tool

### Task

- [ ] : Question Answering dataset #81 🤩
- [ ] : Multiple choice question #464
- [x] : Multiple label in sequence labeling #19 🤩
- [x] : Nested Named Entity Recognition #544 👍
- [x] : Relation Annotation #233 👍

### Auto-Annotation

- [ ] : Implements labeling functions (Weak Supervision) #224 🤩
- [x] : Add Auto-labeling #191

## Toward Production Usage

* Deployment
  - [ ] : Helm chart #701 👍
  - [x] : Support doccano v1.x on Heroku #811
* Security
  - [ ] :  [Proposal] Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed #857
  - [x] : Clarify how to set user own username/password in docker-compose for security #748
* Authentication
  - [ ] : Two factor authentication for admin and annotators #756
  - [ ] : Okta OIDC social login is not available #1255 👍
  - [ ] : Google OAuth support #620 👍
  - [ ] : LDAP-Support #560 👍
* Annotation Workflow
  - [x] : Allow user to change another users' annotation #531 👍
* Annotator Management
  - [ ] : Allow to assign more than one role in a project. #537
  - [ ] : Enhance Statistics: Compare Annotators #114 👍
* Accessibility
  - [x] : Multiple language interface #479

body: One more idea from #831: Implement a control of annotation coverage per document.

issue.title: My proposals for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**UPD: Not updating since 1.1.0 (26 January 2021).**

Good day!

Thank you for your GREAT work!

I have some enhancement requests... Just for a note, maybe. I will update them permanently.

1. ~URLs should become to a corresponding state. On Dataset page, URL is `/projects/4/dataset`. But refreshing the page redirects to `/projects/4` (#595; implemented in #897; see also #992, 976).~
2. ~Pagination, "rows per page" should change URL (#595; also mentioned in #540, #578; implemented in #897). And moreover: every view state should have its own URL.~
3. Put label hints and key shortcut hints back to Annotation page (#635 (merged in non-equivalent #834); mentioned in #509, #627, #776, #991, #1035; see also #829, #834).
4. Show number of imported rows (#1078).
5. Show number of deleting rows only in confirm dialog. It's difficult to delete many rows (#1077).
6. ~Add First/Last pagination links (#615; implemented in #981).~
7. ~IMHO menu should be opened on Project page and/or subpages by default (implementated in #598).~
8. Make limits configurable (#708, #1119, #1124; mentioned in #514 (merged to #521), #575, #706, #853, #1175).
9. Removing rows freezes page. Could it be improved? (#523, #631; implemented in #1115)
10. ~Add importing of Excel and CoNLL files to UI (#650; implemented in #872; mentioned in #847).~
11. Use API error's messages in UI instead of common error messages (#601 (merged in non-equivalent #521)). More concrete importing file's validating errors (mentioned in #521). About login error messages: #910, #739, #911. Other errors: #913, #920, #923, #924, #972, #1052. See also: #485; #521; #150, #157; #651, #723, #23, #1052.
12. ~Use Alpine versions of ~Nginx,~ Node and Python (Docker)? (declined in #659 but then implemented in #795 and partially reversed in #1110; maybe a bad idea, see:  docker-library/docs#904, pypa/manylinux#37; see also #794, #1112).~
13. ~Localize roles and document types in UI (#605; mentioned in https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/976#issuecomment-692186583; implemented in #976).~
14. ~Current number of documents on annotation page should be updated on each annotation (mentioned in #594; implemented in #897).~
15. ~Show current user name (#604; implemented in #664;  improved by #680).~
16. Implement project edit page (#1080; see also #1114).
17. ~Allow digits as annotation keys (#599; implemented in #603).~
18. Hide unaccessible abilities from UI (#922; mentioned in #920, #866 (implemented in #916), #920, #924, #927).
19. ~Show import/export labels format (#591; implemented in #651).~
20. ~Allow to import unlabeled datasets (#658; implemented in #861; mentioned in #516, then merged to #521).~
21. ~On Statistics page, show documents per user statistics, also (in addition to labels per user) (#486; implemented in #678).~ See also p.58.
22. ~Make documentation for: superuser's password changing. (#628; implemented in #856; see also #622).~
23. ~On project's subpages, display project's name (#621; implemented in #691).~
24. ~Incorporate API client (https://github.com/afparsons/doccano_api_client, https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/299#issuecomment-557037552; doccano/doccano-client#3).~
25. "Approved" filter (#725, merged to #505, has been merged to #280); #1060.
26. Display user's current role (#881; mentioned in https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/758#issuecomment-626325760).
27. Display label `id`s column on Labels page alongside their names (#813, merged to #816).
28. Provide a setting: the order of labels (#816; mentioned in #1028).
29. Import datasets using doccano's exported files (#482; implemented in #958; see also #826, #848, #889, #961, #1015).
30. Implement "view only" role (#413; implemented in #430).
31. Implement dataset import using JSON (#454; implemented in #777).
32. Each annotator sees how many documents are being annotated in the project, by him (#830).
33. For each project, introduce a property: minimal number of annotations (of a given document) to indicate the document as "done" (#831; #947; see also #114).
34. ~Allow annotation approvers to change annotations (#703; implemented in #766).~
35. ~Highlight current page in menu (#833; implemented in #899).~
36. Implement document filters: by labels and annotators (#839 (merged in non-equivalent #280)).
37. Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed, in production (#857; see also #748).
38. Set `-x` and `-e`, `-u` on each Bash script (#860).
39. Get rid of v0.x code (related: #786, #1088)..
40. Document and/or minimize production and development difference (#810; mentioned in #925).
41. Align component versions (#870; implemented in #842). Upgrade component versions.
42. Implement an option: confirmation button on Annotation page (declined in #869; mentioned in #477).
43. Implement label groups (#5, #877 (merged in non-equivalent #477); see also #461, #477, #829, #635, #869).
44. Store label ids and user ids on export (#295; implemented in #889).
45. _Show all removing elements  (dependencies) on confirmation._
46. Project export and import (#901).
47. ~Allow annotator to update/delete other's annotations if annotations are shared (#531, #705; see also #866, #629; implemented in #916).~
48. Show statuses of documents on Dataset page (#928).
49. Implement user creation (declined in #930).
50. Use color in labels selector (on Annotation page) (#829).
51. Implement an option to hide some metadata (#1079).
52. ~Export annotations' timestamps (#963; implemented in #964).~
53. ~Implement: live a comment on a document (https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/966#issuecomment-685565644, #1050; implemented in #1155).~
54. Prebuild Docker images (#971; see also: #786, #1088, #783, #1127, #1231).
55. ~Localize interface (#479; implemented in #976).~
56. "Delete all documents" button (implemented in #979).
57. Implement assigning doccument to an annotator (described in #948, #1063).
58. On Statistics page, show density of users in a label statistics; density of labels in a user statistics (#1076).
59. ~Implement "single class classification" project's option implemented in #489, then re-implemented in #1261; see also #1191, #1236).~
60. Implement users control (#1081).
61. Implement true documents pseudo-random shuffling on dataset annotation (#1113; mentionedin  #1072, https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/1072#discussion_r531214151, #1099).
62. ~Change filename on JSONL export (#851; implemented in #1116).~
63. ~Bulk import for multiple files (#953; implemented in #1163).~
64. Provide using without Internet (#1238).

Doccano ~1.0.2~ ~1.0.3~ ~1.0.4~ ~1.0.5~ 1.1.0.

Thanks!

issue.title: Chunk dataset between annotators

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**How can I chunk the dataset between annotators ?**

---

I have several annotators, but I want only 1 annotation per sample. Also I don't want annotators to modify another annotator's work.

---

If I check `share annotations`, people can view, edit, delete annotations. I don't mind they can view, but they can edit and delete annotations, which is a problem.

If I uncheck `share annotations`, people cannot view/edit/delete other's annotations, but they can annotate a sample that was already annotated.

---

Is there any way to chunk the dataset between annotators ? **Or show annotator only sample that were not annotated ?**

body:
> One more idea from #831: Implement a control of annotation coverage per document.

Is it implemented yet ? I can't find the option anywhere in my labeling annotation task
